title: Rodriguez, Singer Whose Career Was Resurrected, Dies at 81
description: Two albums in the early 1970s went largely unnoticed in the United States, but not overseas. Then came the 2012 documentary “Searching for Sugar Man.”

title: Russian Missile Hits Zaporizhzhia, Ukraine, Killing 2
description: Officials said seven people were injured, a church building and several local shops were destroyed, and the windows were blown out of several high-rise buildings.

title: Russia Downs 2 Drones Near Moscow, as Ukraine War’s New Phase Intensifies
description: It was the 12th time in the past three weeks that Russian officials had reported intercepting such aerial attacks in the heart of the capital.

title: Biden Orders Ban on U.S. Investments in China’s Sensitive High-Tech Industries
description: The new limits, aimed at preventing American help to Beijing as it modernizes its military, escalate a conflict pitting the world’s two largest economies against each other.

title: Was That an Earthquake in Rome? No, It Was a Travis Scott Concert.
description: The rap star’s show in Rome at the Circus Maximus, an archaeological site by day and concert venue by night, has raised concerns about the risks posed by crowds.

title: Amid Niger Coup, Nigeria Grapples with Potential Military Intervention
description: An ongoing coup in Niger could shape the future of a West African regional bloc and the presidency of Bola Ahmed Tinubu, the newly elected leader of Nigeria.

title: Does Information Affect Our Beliefs?
description: New studies on social media’s influence tell a complicated story.

title: Poland to Deploy 2,000 Troops To Reinforce Belarus Border
description: Concerns have been mounting in Poland, a NATO member, over the presence of mercenaries from Russia’s Wagner private military company in neighboring Belarus.

title: 11 Killed in Vacation Home Fire in France
description: The victims were on an organized trip for people with mental disabilities in Wintzenheim, near the borders of Germany and Switzerland.

title: Imran Khan Appeals Prison Sentence in Pakistan
description: The former prime minister of Pakistan was jailed after being found guilty in a corruption case. The legal fight will determine his political future ahead of elections later this year.

title: Dozens of Migrants Die After Boat Sinks in Strait of Sicily
description: Survivors said that 41 people, shunted by traffickers onto a small makeshift iron vessel, had drowned after it capsized en route from Tunisia to Italy.

title: U.S. Nurse and Her Child Released by Kidnappers in Haiti
description: The abduction came as gang violence has begun cresting in Haiti and an international force may be headed to the Caribbean island nation to address the insecurity.

title: Trudeau Searches For a New Image After Separation From His Wife
description: Justin Trudeau cultivated the image of a modern husband, father and political figure in his political rise. How does he redefine himself after the breakup of his 18-year marriage?

title: 98 Arrests in Child Abuse Inquiry That Followed Killing of F.B.I. Agents
description: The investigation the 2 agents were part of grew into a larger inquiry that netted members of an online pedophile ring in the U.S. and Australia.

title: Explosion Rips Through Warehouse Near Moscow
description: Russian officials said dozens were injured in the explosion. The warehouse is on the grounds of a plant that produces night vision devices and binoculars, according to local media.

title: Russia-Ukraine War: Ukraine Warns of Renewed Russian Infrastructure Attacks
description: The country’s air force spokesman cautioned that Moscow could seek to resume strikes on energy infrastructure in the fall. Last year, millions of people spent the winter in Ukraine without power.

title: Russia Says It Shot Down 2 Drones  Near Moscow Overnight
description: Until recently, Moscow had rarely been a target of attacks over the course of the 18-month war in Ukraine.

title: After Russian Attack in Ukraine, Broken Glass and Rattled Nerves in Romania
description: A drone assault on a Danube River port sent shock waves — both the physical and the psychological kind — into villages just across the water that are in NATO territory.

title: Baseball Players Visit Mexico’s Basilica de Santa María de Guadalupe
description: When in the capital for road games, many Mexican League players join the throngs paying their respects at the Basílica de Santa María de Guadalupe.

title: Long Taken for Granted, Frozen Peas Seek a New Appeal in the U.K.
description: Britain’s vegetable producers are hoping this is a moment for the humble frozen pea, a cost-effective staple at a time of rising food prices.

title: Mushroom Poisoning Suspected in 3 Deaths, Australia Police Say
description: The three guests, and a fourth who fell ill, had symptoms consistent with mushroom poisoning, the police say. The woman who served the meal has been questioned by the police.

title: How 4 Countries Are Preparing to Bring Stolen Treasures Home
description: While attention is focused on western museums and governments giving back looted items, heritage workers in the global south are laying the groundwork for new claims.

title: Wednesday Briefing
description: A troubled Black Sea.

title: Biden to Restrict Investments in China, Citing National Security Threats
description: The measure to clamp down on investments in certain industries deemed to pose security risks, set to be issued Wednesday, appears likely to open a new front in the U.S.-China economic conflict.
